title: On The Origin of Species - Charles Darwin
King John of England agrees to the Magna Carta
Alexander The Great starts his reign
Iron Age starts in Sub-Saharan Africa
Classic Bronze Age starts - Western Asia and the Near East
First urban city with full-time bureaucracy: Uruk
Earliest evidence for proto-writing (visible marks communicating limited information)
Earliest signs of humans starting sedentary lifestyle
Homo sapiens cross the Bering Strait
First symbols in ice age European cave paintings
Last known Neanderthals walked the Earth
Homo Sapiens likely bred with Neanderthals (again)
Wave 2 Homo sapiens in India and South Asia
Toba Supervolcano explosion - Earth's largest known eruption. Human population dropped as low as 3,000
Homo Sapiens likely bred with Neanderthals (the first time)
Wave 2 Homo sapiens in the Levant (Middle East)
Earliest evidence for use of clothing
Homo Sapiens might have bred with Neanderthals (the actual first time)
Homo erectus in modern Georgia (Middle East)
First stone tools used outside of Africa (China)
earliest known hominin presence outside of Africa
Wave 1 Homo sapiens in West Asia
Oldest indirect evidence of stone tools (fossilised animal bones with tool marks)
Hominiae-Ponginae last common ancestor (Human/Chimp and Gorilla lines
Great Oxidation Event - first significant amount of O2 in atmosphere due to cyanobacteria
